title: Recep Tayyip Erdogan's incursion into Syria has appalled his allies, but will play well for him at home
text:
Turkey’s decision last week to attack the Kurdish forces in northern Syria known as the YPG alarmed Nato and appalled the Kurds' Western military allies, who had promised they would be there for them when a political settlement was finally hammered out.

President Putin of Russia, with whom President Erdogan cleared his lines before launching the air and ground assault, has questioned the effectiveness of the operation.

Even President Trump’s most loyal Republican supporters have sharply criticised him for giving Erdoğan a green light in their phone call on October 6th.
